page.paragraph: Now listen to two students as they discuss the section of the catalogue.
Wow, so you've been accepted by the engineering department as an engineering major?
You need to apply to the engineering department to be accepted as an engineering major, you know. Have you done that yet?
No, I haven't, but I'm sure I'll be accepted when I do.
Well, I've taken most of the prerequisites, and I have a B average. The catalogue says that we need a B average for an engineering major.
The catalogue says that you need a B average to apply to be accepted as an engineering major. It doesn't promise you'll be admitted with a B average, only that you can apply with a B average.
It does? I thought I was OK with a B average, that I was sure to be admitted with a B average, that is.

I don't think so. The catalogue says that you have to have a B average to apply, and I heard that last year only about half of the people who applied were actually accepted to the program. That means that a lot of students with B averages weren't admitted.
Oh, no! That doesn't sound too promising.
Well, you said that you've taken most of the prerequisite courses but not all of them?
Well, maybe you need to get really high grades in the rest of the prerequisite courses if you want to have a better chance of being accepted as an engineering major.
I'm certainly going to try to do that!
